::Shadow Wing::

The power surge subsided and finally stopped. She didn't know if she 
had caused the surge or not.  The surge not only startled her, but 
caused her some pain in her spark. She stopped trying to move her new 
protoform.  She retracted all her connection and withdrew into her 
chamber.  Knowing that Veratis would find out about the power surge, 
she pullled back her last connect to the monitor.  She didn't want to 
make Veratis angry with her.  Her life more or less rested in his 
hands and getting him upset at her wasn't a smart idea.  

Veratis was a great mystery to her.  He had gone through and survived 
against all odds.  What had her wondering was how this bot could 
still have the kind, curious, caring spark of a maximal after all 
that had happened to him. She wondered, once she got a form and could 
talk again, would he be willing to teach her what he knew?  From what 
he said about how long he had lived, that could be one heck of a long 
schooling session.  She thought and wondered if Lunarpine would be 
willing to learn as much as she was willing to learn.  She would have 
smiled at the thought of how he had taught her. She remembered how 
Lunarpine had got her in the field, and then again in the forest.  he 
showed her that she wasn't the warrior that she thought she was. She 
remembered fighting with Lunarpine and putting him in the cr, when 
his optics had been damaged.  She remembered that final fight, where 
she lost her form and almost her life.  She remembered no longer 
being able to see or hear Lunarpine, but being able to feel his 
presance and knowing he was there.  

But now, after the power surge, she stayed inside her chamber and 
didn't try to connect to anything.  She withdrew and didn't venture 
out past her small, power connects feeding her spark.  She didn't 
know how the surdge happened.  But she didn't want to anger Veratis 
and didn't want any more pain.
